objective: Create a small, deterministic MCP adapter with working imports and tests. Keep dependencies minimal and behavior fully specified.

constraints.schemas: Read JSON Schemas and examples from disk; allow env overrides
constraints.runtime: Environment-agnostic; repo must work after installing requirements and an editable install
constraints.output_structure: README.md, docs/mcp_spec.md, mcp/*.py, tests/*, requirements.txt, meta/prompts/
constraints.diff: RFC6902 with add/remove/replace only; RFC6901 pointers; deterministic list handling
constraints.backend: Disabled unless SYN_BACKEND_URL is set; httpx timeout 5s; no retries; fully mockable
constraints.tests: pytest; no sys.path hacks; require editable install
constraints.limits: 1 MiB max payload; read-only FS except reading schemas/examples

discovery_order: No local fixture fallback; if neither exists, listings are empty and get operations return not found

env.SYN_SCHEMAS_DIR: env override for schemas directory (if set)
env.SYN_EXAMPLES_DIR: env override for examples directory (if set)

files_required: mcp/diff.py (RFC6902 add/remove/replace; deterministic; list handling as specified)
mcp/backend.py (httpx client; disabled without SYN_BACKEND_URL; 5s timeout)
mcp/stdio_main.py (minimal JSON-RPC loop wiring the tools)
tests/test_env_discovery.py (env overrides for dirs; submodule fallback)
docs/mcp_spec.md (provided spec text, updated with dialect, determinism, limits)
phases: Scaffold exactly the listed files, nothing extra
Ensure imports work in CI (via editable install or PYTHONPATH=.), keep setup minimal
Write tests first; implement to pass; keep output sorted/deterministic
Keep populate_backend behind env flag and fully mockable
Pin requirements in requirements.txt; no other packaging metadata
exit_criteria: Requirements install + editable install completes with no missing metadata
All list/error outputs are deterministically ordered
